Colors¶

Follows the color convention of matplotlib.

Objects¶

harrison_functions.etc.colors.color_name_to_hex = {'black': '#000000', 'blue': '#1f77b4', 'brown': '#8c564b', 'colorless': '#7f7f7f', 'green': '#2ca02c', 'orange': '#ff7f0e', 'pink': '#e377c2', 'purple': '#9467bd', 'red': '#d62728', 'white': '#7f7f7f', 'yellow': '#FFFF00'}¶

colors from matplotlib


harrison_functions.etc.colors.default_colors = ['#1f77b4', '#ff7f0e', '#2ca02c', '#d62728', '#9467bd', '#8c564b', '#e377c2', '#7f7f7f', '#FFFF00', '#7f7f7f', '#000000']¶

harrison_functions.etc.colors.warm = [[0.0, 'rgb(255,248,248)'], [0.2, 'rgb(254,224,144)'], [0.4, 'rgb(253,174,97)'], [0.6, 'rgb(244,109,67)'], [0.8, 'rgb(215,48,39)'], [1.0, 'rgb(165,0,38)']]¶

colors for heatmap

Functions¶

harrison_functions.etc.colors.generate_label_colors(labels: list, colors: list)¶
Matches labels with colors
If there are more labels than colors, repeat and cycle through colors

harrison_functions.etc.colors.hex_to_rgba(hex_color, opacity=1)¶
Example usage:
Input: #2ca02c
Output: ‘rgba(44, 160, 44, 0)’

harrison_functions.etc.colors.update_rgba_opacity(rgba, new_opacity=0.5)¶
Example usage:
Input: ‘rgba(44, 160, 44, 1)’
Output: ‘rgba(44, 160, 44, 0.5)’
